It was really refreshing to see an owner of a coffee shop so engaged in his costumers, involved in the kitchen, and outgoing. I thought that was really classy.  I'm not only coming back because the owner was so nice, but the food was really good, too. Plus it was super cheap. I ordered their low fat yogurt granola & berry parfait.  My roommate and I split their ham and cheese croissant. It was melt in your mouth heavenly!   I also ordered a latte on the side and it was so good. They make their low fat milk so smooth and frothy. The espresso was strong and smooth!

Great place to feed your caffeine addiction. Quality coffee, lattes, and tea. The menu is limited. I ordered the chicken salad. Not bad at all, but the sandwich was thrown together and the chips were from the bottom of the bag (crumbled and smashed! Gheez! just open a new bag). The dessert, though a good variety, looked old and stale. There were at least 2 flies on the chocolate croissants. The location is pleasing as you can take a moment to walk over to TCBY or Mellow Mushroom. Also the movie theater is upstairs if you prefer.

Rush is the best coffee option for over 15 miles. Not only coffee, but great breakfast, lunch and night life, wine, drinks, food, all around great place. Live music - check. Passionate, present and friendly owner (Paul) - check. Tons of fresh, delicious options, check. Daily specials, check. Oh - and insane bacon jelly compote (whatever it's called) - CHECK. I wish I could take a shower in that stuff. Friendly people that have been working there for years - check! This place has it down to a science. We should all learn from how they do it. If you haven't visited, and you are within a 10-15 miles journey to Ballantyne, go to Rush, you'll see.

When in for a quick breakfast and coffee, ended up waiting 30 minutes for a simple breakfast panini. Frustrating that when we asked where the order was, they simply said it was lost in the process. Cool environment, but not the best customer service. As much as I love supporting local, we will not be coming back to this restaurant because of the overall poor service from the staff.

I've gone here countless times over the past year, and I have hardly been disappointed. The coffee is always wonderful (my favorite is chocolate hazelnut martini) and according to my sister the chai tea is the best she's ever had. If I lived closer, I would get a coffee from here everyday.   I've eaten more breakfasts than lunches here, but it's great all the time. I do prefer the breakfast to the lunch, I feel like it is more expensive for lunch for the amount of food you get. Most of the time I get the eggs benedict, my eggs are always poached perfectly on top of ham and the hashbrowns, all over spinach which is my favorite touch. The fruit option as the side always has a great variety of different fruits, which I love!   Finally, the owner is very charismatic and always greets his customers with a warm smile and converses with his regulars.   A+ all around

I'm not one to put negative reviews but this place definitely deserves it. I was told my food would take 30 minutes to come out. Waited over an hour and still didn't get my order. I asked for a refund since the food never came out and all they can said was "sorry about that" Don't waste your time coming here. If I can give this place a zero I would.

Chain coffee shops seem to be running rampant these days.  It's always refreshing to walk into one that is unique, has it's own style, ample seating, friendly, helpful staff and a good selection on the menu.  Since I had just left dinner, I only had a drink, but it was FAB-U-LOUS.  If you like iced coffee, give a try to the Hazelnut Choc Martini....sooooo good.  seriously.  The desserts and menu items look great, but I can't give a review on them other than appearance, however, i do believe the mini-quiche lorraine is calling my name....o darn....i suppose i'll have to go back there for breakfast/brunch and dessert sometime, :).....and another rousing round of hazelnut choc martini.
Ate here for breakfast twice this week while visiting from out of town. The yogurt crunch and light start were both excellent. Also tried a latte and a chai latte. Both were phenomenal.

Can we say slo-mo expresso? Very slow service with staff members who don't listen well or ask enough questions. Also very limited pastry selection for 11 am on a Sunday. Latte was pretty but mostly foam.

Not living or working in Ballantyne, I don't get by Rush often enough. But having been here a few times recently (twice in the last week alone!), I thought I should leave a glowing review.  Almond Chai Latte - get it! You won't be disappointed. I finally found another coffee shop that makes them exactly the way I like them.  I've been pleasantly surprised by the food options. The chef (can I call him that in a coffee house? I think he's earned the title) even stopped by my table to ask what I thought of the sundried tomato melt - I assured him it was delicious & proved it by ordering it the next time I visited.  For a local shop with stellar coffee & food, I think the prices are reasonable.   Parking at Ballantyne Village continues to be a hassle through no fault of the store owners. (Google the drama about the former BV owner who kept the parking lots & won't allow customers to park there... ) Rush has been busy, so I'm very happy to see customers supporting the stores there.  If you're uptown, check out their new location in Latta Arcade. I haven't been by yet, but hope to trek a few city blocks from my office soon. I'm sure it will be worth it.

Best chai tea in the world! Thanks for helping me boycot Starbucks I will now be a customer at rush FOR LIFE. Super awesome owner, great employees, Healthy food, delicious coffee, awesome atmosphere, 10 stars!!!

Basics first: coffee is good, speciality drinks are good, bakery items are GOOD (give the espresso muffin a try -- thank me later).    Beyond the basics, I love this spot because the atmosphere is great. The staff is always upbeat and helpful, guests are all very polite and generally interacting.  What actually keeps me coming back beyond all that is how amazingly the environment is conducive to productivity.  Every time i go in there I plow through work that I have been putting off.   Caffeine + wifi + upbeat environment ...  adds up to something I can get into.
The chef is the best in town and you should really go here for the best coffee around. Paul the owner is the friendliest cafe owner in Charlotte.   Try the Aussie Meat Pies. They rock.
The coffee is the best! My favorite beverage is the spiced chai latte. The breakfast food is all right, hazelnut French toast was drenched in chocolate and hard to finish.

Rush Espresso is in the former "Dilworth Coffee" location in Ballantyne Village. They've given the space a more modern look since Dilworth Coffee moved out.  They give you the option of either having your coffee drink in a mug (if you're staying there to enjoy) or in the now traditional to all coffee purveyors, the cardboard cup. I personally enjoy being able to get my coffee in a mug since it seems a lot less common at most coffee shops.  In terms of the actual coffee, they use "illy" coffee and of the half dozen visits I've had to "Rush Espresso", the coffee has been great!  I'd definitely recommend them.
We like this place excellent service and attentive the owner and he manager always make a point to say hello to their customers and the food is also pretty good! Live music on Saturdays.

Have to agree with Sally B's review from earlier about Paul and his attitude towards her.  She is a very successful, attractive NYC strong woman and apparently he is not able to handle strong women. Totally unwarranted and offensive enough to cross Rush off our list of places to go.   As she said, not the staff at all, but all him.  Not once during multiple visits did he ever acknowledge her or say anything at all to her, let alone friendly or welcoming.  Enough is enough.

Rush Espresso is a great place tucked into the Ballantyne Village. I feel like I'm in another great coffee house in Seattle. They serve such well made and exquisite coffee and tea. You can tell they take pride in what they do. This is the best coffee I've had in Charlotte.

Me and my boyfriend dig this place! On an average, we go here 7 days a week, sometimes twice a day! In winter I was hooked onto their mint mocha. I also love the Fruit de la Passion tea that my boyfriend orders, which has a very pleasant Passion Fruit favor (I never order herbal teas at cafes myself, but steal my boyfriend's all the time). I particularly love their chai though, Vanilla more than the Spiced. I always order them with 2% milk so they froth more. This place is just amazing! And it is a lot of fun to sit outside, watching the life at Ballantyne Village. The servers as well as the owner are very sweet and friendly too!
This please is great. I come here often to work or study. Their coffee is excellent and their food is underrated. It's fantastic

I have been going to Rush for coffee for a few years, but just recently started ordering breakfast. The croissant with egg and Swiss is delicious especially with a lovely latte. Fast courteous service, too

This place is adorable. I am a coffee addict and especially love a good locally owned shop. I came in here early before class to grab a quick study session. There are probably ten to twelve tables but they do have a wonderful outdoor seating area that is a pretty decent size.   They have great food and coffee (duh!)  I came in and had the power bagel. I think it was called that. Anyways it had ham, Swiss, avavado, tomato, spinach, an cream cheese. What a great way to start the morning! I have had coffee wise two different drinks. The vanilla latte which was so amazing. They serve their coffee drinks in clear glass glasses and do a beautiful little design on top of the foam. I have also had the chai tea latte. I found the chai tea to be a little more sweet than I typically like it so I didn't finish it. They have a choice of vanilla spice or regular spice and maybe I had the vanilla. The location is great and seems to be convenient to everything!! Love this place and look forward to trying every drink they offer!

Fun place to hang out. Great coffee in the am. Love the vibe with music and wine on the weekends. Don't think I've had a full meal here in a while but we've had great apps, desserts etc.. Check it out!

Love this place. Best coffee in town. Never bitter, nice smooth blend. Brought my mom here who is very picky and she loved it too. Staff is always helpful and kind. Love their daily coffee happy hour and new coffee martini. Delicious!

I thoroughly enjoyed my first visit to Rush, and I'm sure it won't be my last. With Adam R's affinity (addiction?) to coffee and that fact that he now works in the area, I imagine I'll be returning.  With Charlotte awash in restaurants and coffee shops that revel in their French coffees, a place that specializes in Italian coffees is a fresh change. While Rush very clearly advertises that they use Illy coffees and machines (a well-established provider of Italian coffees and espresso machines), they are still a locally owned, private business - don't let the branding fool you, it's an original.  The coffee is pretty dang awesome. It's light and has just the right touch of bitterness. You can see the owners' little hints of their native Australia mixed into the menu - all of which seems like a pretty good value and branches out beyond just the traditional baked sweets. The names of the menu items are straight-forward and very easy to order.  The interior is very sleek and trendy-modern with lots of stainless steel and bold colors. The patio is spacious with at least as many tables outside as inside.  Can't wait to try them again!
I ordered a coffee today, and it was cold. I just don't understand: how could you bring someone a cold cup of coffee. I had to request it be put in the microwave. Just why?

Are you fucking kidding me, Rush Expresso? This morning I fasted before my physical and decided to treat myself to breakfast here. I ordered a Egg and Avo Burger with bacon. I waited for 30 minutes before they realized that they never placed my order, and then, ten minutes later, I was handed a lukewarm lemony, watery mess. No bacon. No apologies.  I loved this place for their vanilla chai, but honestly, this was the worst customer service experience I've ever had. A 40 minute wait during morning rush hour for an incorrect order is completely unacceptable. I wish I could give negative ratings.

Their new location is a lot roomier with lots of seating options both indoor and outdoor.  I ordered the breakfast guacamole benedict and a cappuccino. The benedict was pretty tasty - there are 2 poached eggs on top of guacamole and spinach on sourdough with baby tomatoes on the side. The best part is when you break the egg and you soak up the yolk that runs down the side with the bread. It's definitely pricey for the portion ($12) but it's a good option for a healthy, light breakfast. They bring your food out to you but they call your name once they make your coffee and you have to go to the counter and get it. Coffee tastes similar to what you would get in Europe, but sizes are smaller also.

Came in during Happy Hour and got my drink half price off. It's a great brunch place with a various sandwich/panini options on the menu. They have a plenty of space-good place to get some work done while enjoying some great coffee. I also like their location too. Very convenient and relatively easy parking compared to other cafes in downtown area.

My favorite go to place for a great cup of coffee in Charlotte or to meet up with friends to have a nice glass of vino from their extensive list of wines! Love the owners and their energy. They have become a huge success in Charlotte with more than one location including Piccadilly Cafe!
I'm bummed that the parking situation could put this place at risk - they're lovely and the service is always above and beyond....

This has quickly become our go-to place for a good night out. The food and the wine have been consistently good the few times we have been here. They often do live music but somehow we keep managing to miss it but looking forward to going again soon.
Wish I knew this place was closing.  Rode up. No longer there. And I was just here Sunday.

I must be on a quest to find the best cafés in Charlotte because I can't stop checking out these places.   I got a caffe mocha with pumpkin syrup and it was absolutely delicious. They had a lot of syrup flavors like vanilla, peppermint, etc.. When I went to check out, my total was only $1.90! Apparently they have happy hour everyday from 3-4 PM. Drinks are half off excluding those with ice cream and smoothies.   I was a little disappointed because my drink came in a to go cup when I said the order was for here, but the taste made up for it. There is both indoor and outdoor seating, plus strong wifi!   I will be back to try more of their drinks and maybe even some of the pastries too. Sorry Starbucks, I'm coming here now.

I'm going to start this with I am not a big fan of places like these. So many people working and holding meetings , we stopped going to Amelie's because the tables were always filled with people working. That being said I loved this place, the coffee was good, I had the poached eggs and I am going to say they were some of the best poached eggs ever. I hate when poached eggs are wet when you get them, these were dry and perfectly creamy. I had some tea and my friend also ahda meal which she loved.   While there are a lot of people there working, I never once felt crowded by them and actually enjoyed listening to some of the sales pitches I heard.I actually took out some paper from my bag and started to write down some ideas I had for my projects. I can't wait to go back, maybe have one of those ginormous sugar donuts and definitely some poached eggs
I've never been more impressed with an owner of a business. It shows! Amazing service - perfect lattes - food is prepared with excellence!

The beet latte is good, and the hash brown burger is delicious.  The "egg and avo" burger was okay, not worth the $9, an extra $3 if you add meat.  The guy making the lattes was nice, everyone else seemed too busy, but at 7:30 in the morning on a Sunday, really how busy are you? (We were the only ones in the shop.) I especially couldn't stand that they repeatedly walked by our table without saying, "hi", smiling or at least taking away our plates. Who likes a messy restaurant? We asked one lady to help take the plates away, she said she would be back, and never did return. And la piece de resistance... The dirty cup that was available for water.... Yuck.
Great coffee, very busy but cashier seem to keep things moving alone very quickly with a smile

I go here often because my friends like it. Good prices and great food selection.The Strawberry smoothie was too much milk, not enough berry. I've purchased 2 other coffee drinks but I can't remember what they were... The tea needs an upgrade, PG Tips would be my suggestion. Nice presentation on everything.

Great latte! I just tried their new uptown location in the Latta Arcade. Cool little Cafe. I got a nonfat latte. Generally I have to dump some sugar or more cream in it to enjoy (I'm not a huge coffee person, but still enjoy it), but I did nothing to their cup and it was awesome. Cool design art in the foam, the Barista knew what he was doing. They gave me the classic jab at Starbucks "we don't burn our beans" speech. Which is fine, even though I don't think Starbucks burns their coffee; it's just a different bold roasting process they go through. Anyways....  the coffee was great. Price was fine. Will be a regular when I want to stretch the legs and grab a cup of coffee at work.

Food was awesome and the environment is great too, casual, nice music, lots of natural light and the staff very friendly!   Good quality coffee but too sweet, hard to finish ;(  Totally worth the drive from Southpark!

This place is a hidden gem, I love it!!!  The coffee is second to none, and the hollandaise sauce they serve on their eggs Benedict is the best I've ever had in the whole of America...   All the staff are super friendly, and the owner is a ripper bloke, top notch in my books, you won't be disappointed!!!

Super cute, would definitely come back! Nice employees, chill atmosphere, good drinks. I got the beetroot latte, and while I'm a coffee fan it was nice to get some veggie-powered energy. It had some nice spices in it, tasted like gingerbread!

The hubby and I had a fabulous little date night at Rush last night!  The ambiance is lovely, food was delicious, and the service was even better.  We had the crab and asparagus risotto that was incredibly tasty and we split some cheesecake that was out of this world.  We chatted with the GM, Stephen Johnson, for a while and he was super fun and entertaining.  We'll definitely be back!!!
Wow what a great find, delicious Cappuccino, fantastic atmosphere, terrific music had Scoot Pittman tonight. Highly recommend .
Disappointed went in for a bagel it took 30 minutes to get and they forgot to toast it cold bagel with peanut butter

Had breakfast here on Thursday morning with my husband. As soon as we walked in,  we were greeted and it was a pleasant experience. You place your order at the counter and then grab a number and a it down at a table. Your drinks are followed by food order are then brought to your table. There is a self-serve counter with water and glasses and milk and sugar, etc. That was nice as my husband usually drinks several glasses of water and this way he didn't have to bother anyone for them. There were plenty of tables to sit at and there were outlets and WiFi,  so you could work there.    The food was good and light. The presentation of the food was likely the prettiest I've ever seen my breakfast presented. If you're looking for a reasonably priced and good coffee and a seat,  then you're gonna find that. And,  you can get a yummy and healthy light breakfast that is a little on the pricey side.  If you're looking for a large breakfast to cure you from a hangover or prep you for some intense day of running,  this is probably not the place for you.  Would definitely come back here for a coffee and a light meal. Also,  this is a good spot if you want to have a chat with someone over breakfast/coffee. It's not too loud.  Just depending on the level of privacy you need for the conversation,  you might want to choose a further table from where everyone else is sitting.

I always enjoy having coffee when it's not from the green lady people and Rush does an excellent double espresso. Just as good? The lemon cheese pastry with a side of sweetened cream cheese. Delicious!  I sat here at Rush for about an hour and used a good amount of their wifi while drinking my coffee and eating that pastry. Mostly decent music played and there were several interesting conversations going on that kept me entertained.  Cold morning, so the outside seats weren't occupied and there were still a couple of two-tops available inside. I liked this place!

When I lived in Ballantyne, I'd end up at Rush as often as possible - steering potential coffee meetings to a place other than the giant green-themed chain. Enter Rush.  Occupying the former Dilworth Coffee location in Ballantyne Village, it's got virtually nothing in common with its predecessor. The space is modern and fairly austere in its appointment. There's a ton of outdoor seating as well.  As for the coffee, they recently switched to Lavazzo, which is fine by me. I wasn't particularly attached to Illy, their original supplier.  The menu is large, offering a wide selection of brewed coffee, espresso drinks, teas, smoothies, etc. Delectable offerings line the pastry case, and breakfast/lunch sandwiches are available to order.  It has more of a café feeling rather than a coffee shop, which I rather enjoy.   The owner is friendly and always goes out of his way to greet customers. Pretty much all the employees are overtly affable. A nice touch.  The usual lovelies: free wifi, no withering glances designed to make you leave your chair after hanging out and working for an hour or two, gender-specific bathrooms, indie music playing...  Prices aren't especially low, but I don't mind. It's worth it, to me. I just wish I lived closer and could frequent this south Charlotte gem more often.

Rush Espresso why have I waited so long to walk in?  This place is fantastic! The people are great, love their accents, and they are genuinely happy to see you. It's happy and comfortable, quiet and relaxing. Latte's are great, desserts are better. I' ll be back soon and often.

I absolutely loved the ambiance of this cute little cafe. On one side they have coffee, sweets and sandwiches and the other side they have wine. This is definitely somewhere I would come to hangout and get some work done.  I wish they had a better selection of packaged coffee but I bought a bag anyway to grind at home. The prices are a bit high for the sizes they offer, but it was still a great cup of coffee.
I wish I would have known about this place a long time ago. This is great coffee and desserts. I didn't go to the old location but the new one is nice. Cute seating arrangement. Very good expresso

The experience I had was such a shame. I went in with a friend and while trying to decide what to order asked the young man on the register if they could do Cortado's (a shot of espresso with a little milk). He asked his female coworker (looked like she was the cook) if she could do a cortado and she said yes. The young man started entering an item into the register, to which I said, "hang on, I'm still deciding." He than recommended I try a latte so I went with his suggestion. My friend ordered food and I even said at the register that I was sorry to make her eat alone. When they brought out my friend's food, they also brought out a frittata. We said we hadn't ordered that and the guy took it back. A minute later the female cook came out and asked in an aggressive tone if I just didn't like the frittata or decided I didn't want it. I was confused and said I'd never ordered it. She said "Didn't you ask about the frittata?" I wasn't sure why I was being questioned when I had just said that I didn't order a frittata and no, never even asked about it. She was obviously annoyed as she took it back.  My friend and I were both kind of taken back by the experience. Some time later, I realized they must have misheard me when I'd asked for a cortado. I went to the counter and told the gentlemen that that was the case thinking it would bring some clarity to the confusion. He corrected my pronunciation of how I was saying cortado (by calling it a cortadito - which is another drink but who's counting) but said nothing else. No, "sorry about our miscommunication", "that was our fault", "sorry for charging your friend for a meal she didn't order", nothing. Just the same look of annoyance we got from the female employee.  Maybe I'm expecting too much from coffee shop employees but the place really did seem to be about more than that. The food presentations looked like they did have some real passion for what they were doing, much more so than a normal coffee shop. Maybe that's why it was such a disappointment to leave feeling like I'd been accused by the staff for what was their error.   It's unfortunate that the customer service was so bad when the coffee was good and the food did look great. Luckily, I can get great coffee and great food plus customer service that doesn't leave me feeling confused at a number of other places.
